alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 2:57AM PST until January 08 at 12:20PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. .Little rain is forecast this weekend. The Newaukum River near Chehalis will continue to recede falling below flood stage early this morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Newaukum River Near Chehalis. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 202.5 feet, flood waters will inundate many roads and residential and commercial areas along the Newaukum River and its forks. Flooding in some areas may be deep and hazardous especially near rivers. Impacted roadways and surrounding areas include Jackson Hwy. and Tune, Rush, Sommerville, Griel, Hamilton, Tauscher, Guerrier, Kirkland, Macomber, Rice, Senn, Lucas Creek, Middle Fork and North Fork Roads. A stage of 202.5 feet on the Newaukum roughly corresponds to Phase 2 flood in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM PST Saturday the stage was 202.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The river crested at 205.6 feet late Thursday evening. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue receding through the weekend. - Flood stage is 202.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1100 AM PST.
